title: Educational Pathways
description: Toastmasters Pathways is our comprehensive learning experience that combines online learning with practical application in our meetings.

evaluations.strengths: I really liked how the speaker went straight into quite a thoughtful, conversational answer, giving lots of insight. There was great imagery - 'Imagine there was a cat here' - which gave us something to work with and brought the point to life.
evaluations.improvements: Could use more emphasis and be bolder. Vary tone more - make it dramatic to bring those points alive and transform it from conversation to performance.

evaluations.strengths: Sophie managed to put the power of three in twice! She talked about three practical things, then moved to 'if I could think about anything, here are three things.' Her voice actually changed when moving from practical to fantasy - great tonal variation.
evaluations.improvements: Speak louder and project voice more. Imagine speaking to the person at the end of the room. It's challenging in this outdoor environment, but good practice for projecting.

evaluations.strengths: Really flipped that question on its head - bold answer! Then there was a personal story about Formula One which was quite endearing to hear. Brought it back to the main point at the end too.
evaluations.improvements: Could play up the personal story even more - add more excitement and energy to that moment. You've set up the scene, now really make us feel your enthusiasm!

evaluations.strengths: Owen had a personal story that was really good to hear. We heard about growing up, what he'd like to do, trying to learn guitar - you could really follow along on a chronology. Really confident delivery.
evaluations.improvements: Could add audience interaction - maybe ask 'hands up if this happened to you?' I feel like we've probably all done something like that. Would connect us to you as a speaker.

feedbackPrinciple.title: Key Principle of Feedback at MLP
feedbackPrinciple.content: Evaluations benefit everyone, not just the person being evaluated. Everyone should listen and apply feedback to their own speaking.
